name: HITRUST CSF v11
description: The HITRUST Common Security Framework (CSF) is a certifiable security framework that provides organizations with a comprehensive, flexible, and efficient approach to regulatory compliance and risk management. HITRUST CSF harmonizes the requirements of multiple authoritative sources including ISO 27001, NIST, HIPAA, PCI DSS, and COBIT to provide a unified framework for managing information risk across healthcare and other regulated industries.

domains.name: Information Security Management Program
domains.description: Establishment and maintenance of an information security management program that provides governance, oversight, and direction for security activities across the organization.

controls.title: Information Security Management Program Governance
controls.description: Establish and maintain a formal information security management program with defined governance structure, executive sponsorship, and organizational accountability for information protection.

controls.title: Information Security Roles and Responsibilities
controls.description: Define and assign information security roles and responsibilities to ensure accountability for the protection of organizational information assets.

controls.title: Security Program Objectives and Planning
controls.description: Define measurable security program objectives and develop strategic and operational plans to achieve those objectives aligned with business goals.

controls.title: Security Program Review and Improvement
controls.description: Conduct periodic reviews of the information security management program to ensure continuing suitability, adequacy, and effectiveness, and implement improvements as needed.

controls.title: Security Resource Management
controls.description: Allocate adequate resources including personnel, budget, and technology to support the implementation and operation of the information security management program.

controls.title: Coordination of Information Security
controls.description: Coordinate information security activities across different organizational units, ensuring integration with business processes and alignment with overall governance.

controls.title: Regulatory and Legal Requirements Identification
controls.description: Identify and document all applicable legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements related to information security and ensure the program addresses those requirements.

controls.title: Information Security Performance Measurement
controls.description: Establish metrics and measurement processes to evaluate the effectiveness of the information security management program and report results to stakeholders.

domains.name: Access Control
domains.description: Controls to limit access to information assets and processing facilities based on business and security requirements, ensuring authorized access and preventing unauthorized access.

controls.title: Access Control Policy
controls.description: Establish, document, and maintain an access control policy based on business and security requirements that defines access rules and rights for users, processes, and systems.

controls.title: User Registration and De-registration
controls.description: Implement a formal user registration and de-registration process to enable assignment and revocation of access rights for all user types and systems.

controls.title: Privileged Access Management
controls.description: Restrict and control the allocation and use of privileged access rights through formal authorization, monitoring, and periodic review processes.
typical_evidence: Privileged access request and approval records

controls.title: User Access Reviews
controls.description: Conduct periodic reviews of user access rights to verify that access remains appropriate and remove or adjust access that is no longer required.

controls.title: Password Management
controls.description: Establish and enforce password management practices including complexity requirements, rotation, storage, and transmission controls to protect authentication credentials.

controls.title: Multi-Factor Authentication
controls.description: Implement multi-factor authentication for access to sensitive systems, remote access, and privileged accounts to strengthen identity verification.

controls.title: Session Management
controls.description: Implement session management controls including automatic session timeouts, session locking, and re-authentication requirements to prevent unauthorized access from unattended sessions.

controls.title: Network Access Control
controls.description: Control access to networks and network services based on business requirements, implementing segmentation and filtering to restrict unauthorized network traffic.

controls.title: Remote Access Management
controls.description: Manage and control remote access to organizational systems through secure methods, monitoring, and authorization requirements.

controls.title: Separation of Duties
controls.description: Implement separation of duties to reduce the risk of unauthorized or unintentional modification or misuse of organizational assets, ensuring no single individual controls all critical functions.

domains.name: Human Resources Security
domains.description: Controls to ensure that employees, contractors, and third-party users understand their information security responsibilities and are suitable for their roles throughout the employment lifecycle.

controls.title: Pre-Employment Screening
controls.description: Conduct background verification checks on candidates for employment, contractors, and third-party users in accordance with relevant laws, regulations, and proportional to business requirements.

controls.title: Terms and Conditions of Employment
controls.description: Establish and communicate contractual agreements with employees and contractors that state their information security responsibilities and obligations.

controls.title: Security Awareness Training
controls.description: Provide all employees and relevant contractors with appropriate security awareness education and training, and regular updates in organizational policies and procedures relevant to their job function.

controls.title: Disciplinary Process
controls.description: Maintain a formal disciplinary process for employees who commit information security breaches, ensuring consistent and fair handling of security violations.

controls.title: Termination and Change of Employment
controls.description: Ensure that information security responsibilities that remain valid after termination or change of employment are defined, communicated, and enforced through access revocation and asset return.

controls.title: Role-Based Security Training
controls.description: Provide specialized security training to personnel with significant information security roles and responsibilities, including system administrators, developers, and incident responders.

controls.title: Acceptable Use of Assets
controls.description: Define and enforce rules for the acceptable use of information, assets, and technology resources associated with information processing facilities.

controls.title: Insider Threat Program
controls.description: Establish and maintain an insider threat program to detect, prevent, and respond to potential threats from individuals with authorized access to organizational systems and data.

domains.name: Risk Management
domains.description: Controls to identify, assess, treat, and monitor information security risks to ensure that risk exposure remains within acceptable levels defined by the organization.

controls.title: Risk Management Framework
controls.description: Establish and maintain a comprehensive risk management framework that defines the approach, methodology, and criteria for identifying, assessing, and treating information security risks.
typical_evidence: Risk management policy and framework document

controls.title: Risk Assessment Process
controls.description: Perform systematic risk assessments at planned intervals or when significant changes occur to identify threats, vulnerabilities, and potential impacts to organizational information assets.
typical_evidence: Risk assessment schedule and completion logs

controls.title: Risk Treatment
controls.description: Select and implement appropriate risk treatment options (mitigate, accept, transfer, avoid) for identified risks and document treatment decisions and rationale.

controls.title: Risk Register Maintenance
controls.description: Maintain a risk register that documents all identified risks, their assessments, treatment decisions, risk owners, and current status for ongoing monitoring and reporting.
typical_evidence: Risk register update and review logs

controls.title: Risk Monitoring and Reporting
controls.description: Continuously monitor risk levels and report on risk status to relevant stakeholders, including changes in risk exposure and effectiveness of risk treatments.
typical_evidence: Periodic risk status reports to management

controls.title: Threat Intelligence Integration
controls.description: Integrate threat intelligence into the risk management process to stay current with emerging threats and adjust risk assessments and controls accordingly.

controls.title: Supply Chain Risk Management
controls.description: Identify, assess, and manage risks associated with the supply chain and third-party service providers that may impact the security of organizational information.

domains.name: Security Policy
domains.description: Controls for developing, implementing, reviewing, and maintaining information security policies that provide management direction and support for information security.

controls.title: Information Security Policy Document
controls.description: Develop, publish, and communicate a comprehensive information security policy that is approved by management and defines the organization's approach to managing information security.

controls.title: Policy Review and Update
controls.description: Review information security policies at planned intervals or when significant changes occur to ensure their continuing suitability, adequacy, and effectiveness.
typical_evidence: Policy revision history and change logs
Review meeting minutes and approval records

controls.title: Supporting Security Standards and Procedures
controls.description: Develop and maintain security standards and procedures that provide detailed implementation guidance for the information security policy across all relevant domains.

controls.title: Policy Communication and Awareness
controls.description: Communicate security policies to all relevant personnel and external parties, ensuring understanding of security expectations and requirements.

controls.title: Policy Exception Management
controls.description: Establish a formal process for requesting, reviewing, approving, and tracking exceptions to information security policies with compensating controls where necessary.

controls.title: Data Classification Policy
controls.description: Establish a data classification policy that defines classification levels, handling requirements, and labeling procedures for organizational information assets.

controls.title: Encryption and Cryptographic Policy
controls.description: Define and enforce cryptographic policies that specify approved encryption algorithms, key lengths, key management practices, and use cases for cryptographic controls.
typical_evidence: Approved algorithms and key length table

domains.name: Organization of Information Security
domains.description: Controls for establishing a management framework to initiate and control the implementation and operation of information security within the organization and with external parties.

controls.title: Internal Organization of Security
controls.description: Establish a management framework to initiate and control the implementation of information security within the organization, including clear reporting lines and oversight structures.

controls.title: Contact with Authorities
controls.description: Maintain appropriate contacts with relevant authorities including law enforcement, regulatory bodies, and information sharing organizations for incident coordination.

controls.title: Contact with Special Interest Groups
controls.description: Maintain appropriate contacts with special interest groups, security forums, and professional associations to stay current on security threats and best practices.

controls.title: Information Security in Project Management
controls.description: Integrate information security into the organization's project management methodology to ensure security requirements are addressed in all projects regardless of type.
typical_evidence: Security review gates in project lifecycle

controls.title: Segregation of Development, Testing, and Production
controls.description: Separate development, testing, and operational environments to reduce risks of unauthorized access or changes to the operational environment.

controls.title: Teleworking and Remote Work Security
controls.description: Implement security measures to protect information accessed, processed, or stored at teleworking sites, including secure communication and physical security requirements.

controls.title: Authorization Process for New Information Facilities
controls.description: Establish an authorization process for new information processing facilities including assessment of security requirements and approval by appropriate management.
typical_evidence: Security impact assessment for new facilities

domains.name: Compliance
domains.description: Controls to ensure compliance with legal, regulatory, and contractual obligations related to information security and to verify that security practices conform to organizational policies and standards.

controls.title: Identification of Applicable Legislation
controls.description: Identify, document, and keep up to date all relevant legislative, statutory, regulatory, and contractual requirements for each information system and the organization.

controls.title: Intellectual Property Rights Compliance
controls.description: Implement procedures to ensure compliance with legislative, regulatory, and contractual requirements related to intellectual property rights and use of proprietary software.

controls.title: Data Protection and Privacy of Personal Information
controls.description: Ensure the protection and privacy of personal information as required by relevant legislation, regulations, and contractual clauses.

controls.title: Compliance Monitoring and Audit
controls.description: Conduct regular compliance monitoring and audits to verify adherence to information security policies, standards, and regulatory requirements.
typical_evidence: Audit finding tracking and remediation records

controls.title: Technical Compliance Checking
controls.description: Perform regular technical compliance checks of information systems against security policies, standards, and hardening baselines.

controls.title: Records Retention and Protection
controls.description: Protect records from loss, destruction, falsification, unauthorized access, and unauthorized release in accordance with legal, regulatory, contractual, and business requirements.

controls.title: Regulatory Change Management
controls.description: Monitor changes in applicable laws, regulations, and industry standards to assess impact on the organization's information security program and initiate necessary updates.

domains.name: Asset Management
domains.description: Controls to identify organizational assets and define appropriate protection responsibilities to ensure that information assets receive an appropriate level of protection.

controls.title: Asset Inventory
controls.description: Identify and maintain an inventory of all information assets including hardware, software, data, and services, with designated asset owners.

controls.title: Information Classification
controls.description: Classify information in terms of legal requirements, value, criticality, and sensitivity to unauthorized disclosure or modification.

controls.title: Information Handling
controls.description: Develop and implement procedures for handling information assets in accordance with their classification, covering processing, storage, transmission, and disposal.

controls.title: Media Handling and Disposal
controls.description: Manage and control removable media in accordance with the classification scheme and ensure secure disposal of media when no longer required.

controls.title: Return of Assets upon Termination
controls.description: Ensure that all employees and external party users return all organizational assets in their possession upon termination of employment, contract, or agreement.

controls.title: Data Flow Mapping
controls.description: Identify and document data flows including data types, sources, destinations, and transmission methods to support risk assessment and compliance efforts.

controls.title: Cloud Asset Inventory and Tagging
controls.description: Maintain an inventory of cloud-based assets including compute instances, storage resources, and services, with consistent tagging for classification and cost tracking.

controls.title: Software License Management
controls.description: Track and manage software licenses to ensure compliance with licensing agreements and prevent unauthorized or unlicensed software usage.

domains.name: Physical and Environmental Security
domains.description: Controls to prevent unauthorized physical access, damage, and interference to the organization's information processing facilities and information.

controls.title: Physical Security Perimeter
controls.description: Define and implement physical security perimeters to protect areas containing information processing facilities and sensitive or critical information.
typical_evidence: Facility floor plans with security zones

controls.title: Physical Entry Controls
controls.description: Secure areas shall be protected by appropriate entry controls to ensure that only authorized personnel are allowed access to facilities and data centers.

controls.title: Securing Offices, Rooms, and Facilities
controls.description: Design and apply physical security for offices, rooms, and facilities that process or store sensitive information.

controls.title: Environmental Threat Protection
controls.description: Apply physical protection against natural disasters, malicious attack, or accidents including fire, flood, earthquake, and environmental hazards.

controls.title: Equipment Siting and Protection
controls.description: Site and protect equipment to reduce risks from environmental threats and hazards, and to reduce opportunities for unauthorized access.

controls.title: Power Supply and Cabling Security
controls.description: Protect equipment from power failures and disruptions, and protect power and telecommunications cabling carrying data or supporting information services from interception or damage.

controls.title: CCTV and Physical Monitoring
controls.description: Implement video surveillance and physical monitoring systems to detect and deter unauthorized physical access to sensitive areas.

controls.title: Secure Equipment Disposal
controls.description: Ensure that items of equipment containing storage media are verified to ensure sensitive data and licensed software has been removed or securely overwritten prior to disposal or re-use.

domains.name: Communications and Operations Management
domains.description: Controls to ensure the correct and secure operation of information processing facilities, including operational procedures, change management, and protection against malware.

controls.title: Documented Operating Procedures
controls.description: Document, maintain, and make available operating procedures for information processing and communication facilities to all users who need them.

controls.title: Change Management
controls.description: Control changes to the organization, business processes, information processing facilities, and systems that affect information security through a formal change management process.

controls.title: Capacity Management
controls.description: Monitor and tune the use of resources and make projections of future capacity requirements to ensure the required system performance and availability.

controls.title: Protection Against Malware
controls.description: Implement detection, prevention, and recovery controls to protect against malware, combined with appropriate user awareness programs.

controls.title: Backup and Recovery
controls.description: Make backup copies of information, software, and system images and test them regularly in accordance with an agreed backup policy.

controls.title: Event Logging and Monitoring
controls.description: Produce, maintain, and regularly review event logs recording user activities, exceptions, faults, and information security events.

controls.title: Clock Synchronization
controls.description: Synchronize the clocks of all relevant information processing systems within the organization to a single reference time source for accurate event correlation.

controls.title: Network Security Management
controls.description: Manage and control networks to protect information in systems and applications, implementing security controls for network traffic and services.

controls.title: Secure Information Transfer
controls.description: Protect information involved in electronic messaging and electronic commerce, maintaining security during transfer within and outside the organization.
typical_evidence: Encryption standards for data in transit

controls.title: Vulnerability Management
controls.description: Obtain timely information about technical vulnerabilities of information systems being used, evaluate exposure, and take appropriate measures to address the associated risk.

domains.name: Information Systems Acquisition, Development, and Maintenance
domains.description: Controls to ensure that information security is an integral part of information systems across the entire lifecycle, including systems that provide services over public networks.

controls.title: Security Requirements Analysis and Specification
controls.description: Include information security related requirements in the requirements for new information systems or enhancements to existing systems.
controls.category: Information Systems Acquisition, Development, and Maintenance

controls.title: Secure Development Policy
controls.description: Establish and apply rules for the development of software and systems within the organization, including secure coding practices and development standards.
controls.category: Information Systems Acquisition, Development, and Maintenance

controls.title: Secure Development Environment
controls.description: Establish and appropriately protect secure development environments for system development and integration efforts covering the entire system development lifecycle.
controls.category: Information Systems Acquisition, Development, and Maintenance

controls.title: System Change Control Procedures
controls.description: Control changes to systems within the development lifecycle using formal change control procedures including testing, review, and approval processes.
controls.category: Information Systems Acquisition, Development, and Maintenance

controls.title: Application Security Testing
controls.description: Perform security testing of applications during development and prior to deployment, including static analysis, dynamic testing, and penetration testing.
controls.category: Information Systems Acquisition, Development, and Maintenance

controls.title: Input Data Validation
controls.description: Validate data input to applications to ensure the data is correct and appropriate, preventing injection attacks and data corruption.
controls.category: Information Systems Acquisition, Development, and Maintenance

controls.title: Cryptographic Controls
controls.description: Develop and implement a policy on the use of cryptographic controls for protection of information, including key management procedures.
controls.category: Information Systems Acquisition, Development, and Maintenance

controls.title: Secure System Architecture
controls.description: Design and implement information system architectures that incorporate security principles including defense in depth, least privilege, and fail-secure defaults.
controls.category: Information Systems Acquisition, Development, and Maintenance

controls.title: Software Supply Chain Security
controls.description: Manage security risks associated with third-party software components, open-source libraries, and software supply chain dependencies.
controls.category: Information Systems Acquisition, Development, and Maintenance

controls.title: API Security
controls.description: Implement security controls for application programming interfaces (APIs) including authentication, authorization, rate limiting, input validation, and monitoring.
controls.category: Information Systems Acquisition, Development, and Maintenance

controls.title: Database Security
controls.description: Implement security controls for databases including access controls, encryption, activity monitoring, and protection against SQL injection and other database-specific threats.
controls.category: Information Systems Acquisition, Development, and Maintenance

domains.name: Information Security Incident Management
domains.description: Controls to ensure a consistent and effective approach to the management of information security incidents, including communication on security events and weaknesses.

controls.title: Incident Response Plan
controls.description: Establish and maintain an incident response plan that defines roles, responsibilities, procedures, and communication protocols for responding to information security incidents.
typical_evidence: Incident response team roster and roles

controls.title: Incident Detection and Reporting
controls.description: Implement mechanisms for detecting, reporting, and collecting information security events and incidents from all relevant sources in a timely manner.

controls.title: Incident Assessment and Triage
controls.description: Assess and triage reported security events to determine if they constitute security incidents and classify their severity and potential impact.

controls.title: Incident Containment and Eradication
controls.description: Contain the impact of security incidents and eradicate the root cause through established procedures for isolation, remediation, and system recovery.

controls.title: Incident Recovery
controls.description: Execute recovery procedures to restore systems and services affected by security incidents to normal operations while maintaining evidence integrity.

controls.title: Lessons Learned and Improvement
controls.description: Conduct post-incident reviews to identify lessons learned, implement improvements to incident response processes, and prevent recurrence of similar incidents.
typical_evidence: Updated procedures based on lessons learned

controls.title: Incident Evidence Collection and Preservation
controls.description: Collect, preserve, and protect evidence related to security incidents following forensic procedures to support potential legal proceedings and investigations.

controls.title: Breach Notification
controls.description: Establish and maintain procedures for notifying affected individuals, regulatory authorities, and other stakeholders in the event of a data breach as required by applicable laws.

domains.name: Business Continuity Management
domains.description: Controls to counteract interruptions to business activities and to protect critical business processes from the effects of major failures or disasters and ensure their timely resumption.

controls.title: Business Continuity Planning
controls.description: Develop and maintain business continuity plans that address information security requirements and ensure the continuity of information security management during adverse situations.
typical_evidence: Continuity plan maintenance and review records

controls.title: Business Impact Analysis
controls.description: Conduct business impact analyses to identify critical business processes, determine maximum tolerable downtime, and prioritize recovery activities.

controls.title: Disaster Recovery Planning
controls.description: Develop and maintain disaster recovery plans for information systems that support critical business processes, including failover and restoration procedures.

controls.title: BCP/DR Testing and Exercises
controls.description: Test and exercise business continuity and disaster recovery plans at planned intervals to ensure they are effective and current.

controls.title: Redundancy and High Availability
controls.description: Implement redundancy and high availability measures for critical information processing facilities to meet availability requirements.

controls.title: Emergency Communications
controls.description: Establish and maintain communication procedures for use during disruptive events to coordinate with internal and external stakeholders.

controls.title: Crisis Management
controls.description: Establish a crisis management framework that defines escalation procedures, decision-making authority, and coordination activities for managing organizational crises.

controls.title: IT Service Continuity Testing
controls.description: Test IT service continuity arrangements including failover mechanisms, backup restoration, and alternate processing capabilities to validate recovery objectives.
typical_evidence: Test lessons learned and improvement plans

domains.name: Privacy Practices
domains.description: Controls to ensure the protection of personal and sensitive information, implementing privacy-by-design principles and compliance with privacy regulations.

controls.title: Privacy Policy and Notice
controls.description: Develop, publish, and communicate a privacy policy and notice that describes how the organization collects, uses, retains, discloses, and disposes of personal information.
typical_evidence: Privacy policy review and update history

controls.title: Consent Management
controls.description: Obtain and manage consent from individuals for the collection, use, and disclosure of their personal information as required by applicable privacy regulations.

controls.title: Data Minimization and Purpose Limitation
controls.description: Limit the collection of personal information to what is adequate, relevant, and necessary for the identified purposes and do not process it in a manner incompatible with those purposes.

controls.title: Individual Rights Management
controls.description: Implement processes to support individuals in exercising their privacy rights including access, correction, deletion, and data portability requests.
typical_evidence: Rights request tracking and response records

controls.title: Privacy Impact Assessment
controls.description: Conduct privacy impact assessments for new or significantly changed processing activities involving personal information to identify and mitigate privacy risks.

controls.title: Data Retention and Disposal
controls.description: Establish and enforce data retention schedules and secure disposal procedures for personal information that is no longer necessary for the identified purposes.

controls.title: De-identification and Anonymization
controls.description: Implement de-identification and anonymization techniques for personal information used for secondary purposes such as analytics, research, or testing.

controls.title: Cross-Border Data Transfers
controls.description: Implement appropriate safeguards for the transfer of personal information across national borders in compliance with applicable privacy regulations.

domains.name: Cloud Security
domains.description: Controls to address the unique security challenges associated with cloud computing environments, including shared responsibility, data sovereignty, and cloud service governance.

controls.title: Cloud Security Strategy and Governance
controls.description: Establish a cloud security strategy and governance framework that addresses the organization's approach to adopting and managing cloud services securely.

controls.title: Cloud Shared Responsibility Model
controls.description: Define and document the shared responsibility model for each cloud service, clearly delineating security responsibilities between the organization and cloud service providers.
typical_evidence: Service level agreements with security terms

controls.title: Cloud Data Protection
controls.description: Implement data protection controls specific to cloud environments including encryption, tokenization, data residency, and protection of data across cloud service models.

controls.title: Cloud Identity and Access Management
controls.description: Implement robust identity and access management controls for cloud environments including federated identity, cloud-native IAM policies, and privileged access controls.

controls.title: Cloud Security Monitoring and Logging
controls.description: Implement comprehensive security monitoring and logging for cloud environments to detect threats, investigate incidents, and maintain audit trails.

controls.title: Cloud Configuration Management
controls.description: Manage and monitor cloud service configurations to prevent misconfigurations that could lead to security vulnerabilities, data exposure, or compliance violations.

controls.title: Cloud Service Provider Assessment
controls.description: Assess cloud service providers before engagement and on an ongoing basis to verify they meet the organization's security and compliance requirements.

domains.name: Mobile Device Security
domains.description: Controls to manage the security risks associated with mobile devices including smartphones, tablets, and laptops used to access organizational information.

controls.title: Mobile Device Policy
controls.description: Establish and enforce a mobile device policy that defines acceptable use, security requirements, and management practices for all mobile devices accessing organizational information.

controls.title: Mobile Device Management
controls.description: Implement mobile device management capabilities to enforce security configurations, deploy applications, and remotely manage devices that access organizational data.

controls.title: Mobile Application Security
controls.description: Implement controls for the secure deployment and use of mobile applications, including application vetting, containerization, and data protection.

controls.title: Mobile Device Encryption and Data Protection
controls.description: Enforce encryption on mobile devices and implement data protection mechanisms to prevent unauthorized access to organizational information on lost or stolen devices.

controls.title: Mobile Device Loss and Theft Response
controls.description: Establish procedures for responding to lost or stolen mobile devices including remote lock, remote wipe, incident reporting, and recovery actions.

controls.title: Mobile Device Network Security
controls.description: Implement network security controls for mobile devices including VPN requirements, Wi-Fi security policies, and secure connectivity standards for accessing organizational resources.
typical_evidence: Wi-Fi security policy for mobile devices

controls.title: Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) Controls
controls.description: Implement specific security controls for personally owned devices used to access organizational resources, including separation of personal and business data.

domains.name: Internet of Things Security
domains.description: Controls to manage the security risks associated with Internet of Things (IoT) devices and connected systems, including medical devices and operational technology.

controls.title: IoT Device Inventory and Classification
controls.description: Identify, inventory, and classify all IoT devices connected to organizational networks, including their purpose, data handling, and risk classification.

controls.title: IoT Network Segmentation
controls.description: Segment IoT devices on dedicated network segments isolated from production networks to limit the potential impact of compromised IoT devices.
typical_evidence: Network access control rules for IoT segments

controls.title: IoT Device Authentication and Access Control
controls.description: Implement authentication and access control measures for IoT devices including credential management, certificate-based authentication, and least privilege access.

controls.title: IoT Firmware and Patch Management
controls.description: Manage firmware updates and security patches for IoT devices to address known vulnerabilities while ensuring device functionality and availability.
typical_evidence: Patch management records for IoT devices

controls.title: IoT Data Protection
controls.description: Implement data protection controls for information collected, processed, and transmitted by IoT devices, including encryption and secure communication protocols.

controls.title: IoT Monitoring and Anomaly Detection
controls.description: Monitor IoT device behavior and network traffic patterns to detect anomalous activity that may indicate compromise or malfunction.
typical_evidence: Baseline behavior profiles for IoT devices

controls.title: IoT Device Lifecycle Management
controls.description: Manage the full lifecycle of IoT devices from procurement through decommissioning, including secure configuration, maintenance, and secure disposal.

domains.name: Third Party Assurance
domains.description: Controls to manage information security risks associated with third-party relationships including vendors, suppliers, business associates, and other external parties.

controls.title: Third-Party Risk Management Program
controls.description: Establish a formal third-party risk management program that governs the assessment, onboarding, monitoring, and offboarding of third parties with access to organizational information.

controls.title: Third-Party Due Diligence and Assessment
controls.description: Conduct due diligence and security assessments of third parties before engagement and periodically thereafter to verify they maintain adequate security controls.
typical_evidence: Vendor risk scoring and tiering records

controls.title: Third-Party Contractual Security Requirements
controls.description: Include information security requirements in contracts and agreements with third parties, covering data protection, incident notification, audit rights, and compliance obligations.

controls.title: Ongoing Third-Party Monitoring
controls.description: Continuously monitor third-party security posture through periodic assessments, performance reviews, and tracking of security events and compliance status.

controls.title: Third-Party Incident Management
controls.description: Establish procedures for managing security incidents involving third parties, including notification requirements, coordination protocols, and joint investigation procedures.

controls.title: Third-Party Offboarding
controls.description: Implement a formal process for offboarding third parties that includes access revocation, data return or destruction, and verification of security obligations completion.

controls.title: Fourth-Party Risk Management
controls.description: Identify and manage risks associated with fourth parties (subcontractors of third parties) that may have access to or impact on organizational information.

domains.name: Endpoint Protection
domains.description: Controls to secure endpoint devices including workstations, servers, and other computing devices through configuration management, protection software, and monitoring.

controls.title: Endpoint Security Baseline Configuration
controls.description: Establish and maintain security baseline configurations for all endpoint types, including hardening standards and secure configuration templates.

controls.title: Endpoint Detection and Response
controls.description: Deploy endpoint detection and response (EDR) solutions on all endpoints to detect, investigate, and respond to advanced threats and malicious activity.

controls.title: Endpoint Patch Management
controls.description: Implement a systematic approach to the identification, evaluation, testing, and deployment of security patches and updates for all endpoint operating systems and applications.
typical_evidence: Patch deployment reports and compliance metrics

controls.title: Endpoint Encryption
controls.description: Enforce full-disk encryption and data-at-rest encryption on all endpoint devices to protect organizational data from unauthorized access in the event of device loss or theft.

controls.title: Application Whitelisting and Control
controls.description: Implement application whitelisting or control measures to prevent unauthorized software from executing on endpoint devices.

controls.title: Host-Based Firewall Management
controls.description: Configure and maintain host-based firewalls on endpoint devices to control network traffic and prevent unauthorized network communications.

controls.title: Endpoint Data Loss Prevention
controls.description: Implement data loss prevention controls on endpoints to monitor, detect, and prevent unauthorized exfiltration of sensitive data through removable media, email, web uploads, and other channels.
typical_evidence: DLP rule definitions and tuning records
DLP incident reports and investigation records

controls.title: Endpoint Compliance Monitoring
controls.description: Continuously monitor endpoint compliance with security baselines, policies, and required configurations, and enforce remediation of non-compliant devices.

controls.title: Secure Endpoint Disposal and Reuse
controls.description: Ensure secure data removal from endpoints before disposal, reuse, or transfer, including verification of data sanitization effectiveness.
